variant.question:
Is it allowed to fly under otherwise identical conditions if a pilot is weighing 10 kg more as given? **Assume that the datum is located in front of the aircraft.**

-  **Item** **Mass (kg)** **Distance aft of the datum (m)**
  </tr>
  <tr> Empty Mass 1 050 3.2
  </tr>
  <tr> Pilot and Copilot or Front PAX 140 1.44
  </tr>
  <tr> Rear PAX 220 2.29
  </tr>
  <tr> Cargo (PAX floor) - 2.31
  </tr>
  <tr> Cargo (PAX foot rest) - 1.70
  </tr>
  <tr> Hold - 3.04
  </tr>
  <tr> Fuel (Mean centering) 276 3.12

**(Forward limit: 2.80 m aft of datum; aft limit: 3.15 m aft of datum)**

options.text: Yes, the new centre of gravity is now located more forward within the allowable range.
Yes, the new centre of gravity is now located 5 cm forward of the aft limit, within the allowable range.
Yes, the increased mass can only have a positive effect.
No, the new centre of gravity is now located 1 cm aft of the aft limit, thus outside the allowable range.

governed by the Traffic Load to be carried. It also provides protection from excessive "wing bending".
governed by the Traffic Load to be carried. It also provides protection from excessive wing bending.
tabulated in the Flight Manual against arguments of airfield elevation and temperature.

 the current mass is 2750 lbs

 Hoever the pilot is very light and the CG is 3 inches outside the aft limit.

The following data is extracted from an aeroplane loading manifest
 Take-off Mass (Performance Limited) 93 500 kg
 Expected Landing Mass at destination 81 700 kg
 Maximum Certificated Landing Mass 86 300 kg
 Take-off Fuel on board 16 500 kg
 During the flight a diversion is made to an en-route alternate which is not performance limited for landing
 Fuel remaining at landing is 10 300 kg
 The Landing Mass?

options.text: is 87 300 kg and excess structural stress could result.
must be reduced to 81 700 kg in order to avoid a high speed approach.
is 83 200 kg which is in excess of the regulated Landing Mass and could result in overrunning the runway.
is 87 300 kg which is acceptable in this case because this is a diversion and not a normal scheduled landing.
